newsArray.title: JayasuriyaтАЩs mantra: CricketersтАЩ career is short so remain fit to make best use of it
creator: Press Trust of India
newsArray.description: Srinagar: Sri Lanka cricket legend Sanath Jayasuria on Saturday dismissed suggestions that too much cricket was leading to burnout saying the playing period at the top level was short and players should make optimum use of it. тАЬThat is an individual opinion and I would not like to comment on it. The period of playersтАЩ [тАж]
newsArray.content: Srinagar: Sri Lanka cricket legend Sanath Jayasuria on Saturday dismissed suggestions that too much cricket was leading to burnout saying the playing period at the top level was short and players should make optimum use of it. тАЬThat is an individual opinion and I would not like to comment on it. The period of playersтАЩ careers is short and they have to make best use of this time,тАЭ Jayasuria told reporters here. The тАШPlayer of the TournamentтАЩ in 1996 World Cup feels that fitness is paramount as the best years will allow an individual to ply his trade in various T20 leagues, which is fast changing the priority for a section of cricketers. тАЬYou cannot say тАШNoтАЩ to these things. At the end, the player has to decide how much his body can take,тАЭ he said. Jayasuriya was non-committal on most issues during his interaction with media. тАЬIt is too early to name three contenders. All the teams are playing good cricket right now,тАЭ Jayarusia replied when asked about favourites for the World Cup. Asked about chances of Sri Lanka, which has to play the qualifiers, going through to the main World Cup event, he said тАЬwe have to qualify first and I am confident.тАЭ Jayasuria threw his weight behind the T20 leagues around the world saying some good players have come to limelight from the instant form of cricket. тАЬIt is an individual opinion (that Test cricket is losing out to T20 cricket). We have seen good players coming through from T20 in India, Australia and Bangladesh,тАЭ he added. The former cricketer, who donned the Sri Lankan colours 586 times across the formats, was all praise for bats made of Kashmir willow тАЬI have played with Kashmiri bats, there is nothing wrong with these bats. It is up-to the individual players (whether they want to use it),тАЭ he said in response to a question. Asked if India and Pakistan should play each other beyond the ICC events, Jayasuria said тАЬI I cannot talk about domestic issues of your country. I am an outsider.тАЭ While refusing to take political questions about India, Kashmir or Sri Lanka, the former Sri Lankan MP said he wanted the media to highlight positive aspects of life in his native country. тАЬMy country went through a bad period. The protests went on for some time. Now the people want a future. We are looking forward. We donтАЩt have any issues now. We want the media to show positive things about Sri Lanka,тАЭ he added. PTI JayasuriyaтАЩs mantra: CricketersтАЩ career is short so remain fit to make best use of it added by Press Trust of India on 1:43 am April 9, 2023 View all posts by Press Trust of India тЖТ Press Trust of India Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Email Print Related

newsArray.description: Arsenal legend Paul Merson has warned Chelsea ahead of their Champions League quarter-final clash with Real Madrid on Wednesday. Merson said it would be a walk in the park for Real Madrid if the Blues approach the game as they did in their Premier League game with Wolves on Saturday. Chelsea were beaten 1-0 by [тАж] UCL: ItтАЩd be pointless going to Real Madrid тАУ Merson warns Chelsea after Wolves defeat
newsArray.content: Daily Post Nigeria UCL: ItтАЩd be pointless going to Real Madrid тАУ Merson warns Chelsea after Wolves defeat Home News Politics Metro Entertainment Sport Sport UCL: ItтАЩd be pointless going to Real Madrid тАУ Merson warns Chelsea after Wolves defeat Published on April 8, 2023 By John Owen Nwachukwu Arsenal legend Paul Merson has warned Chelsea ahead of their Champions League quarter-final clash with Real Madrid on Wednesday. Merson said it would be a walk in the park for Real Madrid if the Blues approach the game as they did in their Premier League game with Wolves on Saturday. Chelsea were beaten 1-0 by the Wanderers courtesy of a 31st-minute strike scored by Matheus Nunes. Merson noted that Chelsea were beaten because they lacked urgency in their game. He warned that if the same thing happens against Real Madrid next week, the Blues could suffer a heavier defeat at the hands of Los Blancos. тАЬMy only benefit of the doubt is theyтАЩre waiting for Wednesday night,тАЭ he told Sky Sports. тАЬThat is the only thing I can think of. If they turn up like that on Wednesday night, it will be pointless going to the second leg. It could be a cricket score.тАЭ Related Topics: chelsea Merson Real Madrid UCL Up Next EPL: Why Arsenal are better than Man Utd тАУ Scholes Don't Miss What I told Zidane that made him headbutt me during 2006 World Cup final тАУ Materazzi You may like Champions League: Lampard gives updates on Kante, Mount, two others ahead of Real Madrid clash EPL: Mikel Obi reveals Chelsea star that never gets credit he deserves EPL: Why Wolves beat Chelsea 1-0 тАУ Lampard EPL: Some Chelsea players donтАЩt know how to score тАУ Lampard reacts to Wolves defeat Chelsea: Mikel Obi names manager Lampard should emulate EPL: Lampard drops Mount from Chelsea squad to face Wolves Advertise About Us Contact Us Privacy-Policy Terms Copyright ┬й Daily Post Media Ltd

newsArray.title: Ajinkya Rahane hits this IPL's fastest 50 in Mumbai win over Chennai
newsArray.description: In another one-sided game, league-leading Rajasthan Royals handed Delhi Capitals their third straight defeat. Mumbai, Delhi and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all at the bottom of the table without a point. Mumbai rested its big signing Jofra Archer as a precaution after the fast bowler complained of pain in his bowling arm. But it was the batting which disappointed.
newsArray.content: Synopsis In another one-sided game, league-leading Rajasthan Royals handed Delhi Capitals their third straight defeat. Mumbai, Delhi and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all at the bottom of the table without a point. Mumbai rested its big signing Jofra Archer as a precaution after the fast bowler complained of pain in his bowling arm. But it was the batting which disappointed. AP Rahane's 61 off 27 balls included a six and four boundaries in one over. Ajinkya Rahane hit the fastest half-century in this Indian Premier League off 19 balls and led Chennai Super Kings to a comfortable seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Saturday. In another one-sided game, league-leading Rajasthan Royals handed Delhi Capitals their third straight defeat. Mumbai, Delhi and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all at the bottom of the table without a point. Mumbai rested its big signing Jofra Archer as a precaution after the fast bowler complained of pain in his bowling arm. But it was the batting which disappointed. Despite a bright start, Mumbai lost its way after captain Rohit Sharma was out for 21 and limped to 157-8. Chennai made short work of that in cruising to 159-3 with 11 balls to spare for its second win in three games. Spinners Ravindra Jadeja (3-20) and Mitchell Santner (2-28) derailed Mumbai's innings. Sharma was brilliantly squared up by Tushar Deshpande (2-31), who hit the top of the middle and off stumps. Chennai was without its own key Englishmen in Ben Stokes (sore heel) and Moeen Ali (ill) and didn't miss them. Rahane's 61 off 27 balls included a six and four boundaries in one over. He raced to his half-century with two successive boundaries against legspinner Piyush Chawla within the powerplay. Rahane was finally dismissed when he miscued Chawla and holed out in the deep in the eighth over. Ruturaj Gaikwad finished off the chase with an unbeaten 40. RAJASTHAN THUMPS DELHI Rajasthan openers Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal smacked half-centuries to launch them to 199-4 and a win by 57 runs. Buttler blazed 79 off 51 balls and Jaiswal, who began with five boundaries in the first over, made 60 off 31 balls. Delhi was squeezed to 142-9. Trent Boult's double-wicket start in his 3-29 set the tone, and spinners Yuzvendra Chahal (3-27) and Ravichandran Ashwin (2-25) frustrated the middle order. Made to bat first, Jaiswal raised his half-century off 25 balls with his 11th boundary by flicking left-arm spinner Axar Patel to wide long on. Jaiswal was dismissed in the ninth over when he top-edged Mukesh Kumar after a rollicking platform of 98 with Buttler. Buttler hit 11 fours and a six and departed in the penultimate over when Kumar juggled a catch off his own bowling. Shimron Hetmyer added a rapid 39 off 21 balls in the death overs, and the total was too intimidating for Delhi. Boult was on a hat trick after he nicked off Prithvi Shaw and pinned Manish Pandey but Rilee Rossouw survived to make 14. Lalit Yadav (38) and David Warner added 64 runs for the fourth wicket before Delhi lost six wickets for 40 runs. Boult returned and broke the stand by trapping Yadav. Warner labored for 55 balls for his 65 before he was lbw to Chahal in the 19th over. ___ More AP cricket: https://apnews.com/hub/cricket and https://twitter.com/AP_Sports DonтАЩt miss out on ET Prime stories! newsArray.title: Twitter Can't Keep Clam As Ajinkya Rahane Hits Fastest Fifty Of IPL 2023 In MI vs CSK Game - Check
newsArray.description: In the fourth over, the 34-year-old batsman from Mumbai smashed left-arm pacer Arshad Khan for 23 runs, including a six and four consecutive fours.
newsArray.content: Making his Chennai Super Kings debut, Ajinkya Rahane played a sensational innings, scoring a blistering half-century against Mumbai Indians in an IPL 2023 match held at the Wankhede Stadium on Saturday. Coming in at no. 3 after the early dismissal of Devon Conway, Rahane hit his first ball for two runs. He then upped the ante in Jason Behrendorff's second over by swivel-pulling a short delivery over deep fine leg for six before unleashing in the next over. Also Read: Watch: Ravindra Jadeja Takes No-Look Stunner To Dismiss Cameron Green, Saves Umpire From Getting Hit #AjinkyaRahane 61(27) _ Fours 7 Sixes 3 Much needed contribution at the right time _ Well played Buddy _ #CSKvsMI @ChennaiIPL pic.twitter.com/2r1skyNC3L тАФ Filmi craft (@filmicraft) April 8, 2023 #AjinkyaRahane Ajinkya Rahane Before Vs Tonight ____ #MIvsCSK pic.twitter.com/BW8Or9sOwk тАФ _________ (@battyphilo) April 8, 2023 Some 61s are more special than others. T20I Debut - 31 August, 2011 61 (39) v _______ IPL Comeback - 8 April, 2023 61 (27) vs #MI #India #CricketTwitter #CSKvsMI #MIvCSK #AjinkyaRahane pic.twitter.com/8fXlOdyyGe тАФ Broken Cricket Dreams Cricket Blog (@cricket_broken) April 8, 2023 #Rahane joined dhoom dhadaka club __ #CSKvsMI #MIvsCSK #AjinkyaRahane pic.twitter.com/fQ9WhU4Kpl тАФ Bindass27 (@bindass27) April 8, 2023 Pure Class, Such a Joyful to watch #Rahane playing a beautiful knock. Quality of Cricket. Always been a great fan of his batting skills. Love you Ajju Bhai... #Jinx ___ @ajinkyarahane88 #AjinkyaRahane #CSKvsMI #MIvsCSK #IPL2023 Hope to you see in #wtcfinal тАФ Harish__ (@harish_207) April 8, 2023 People will remember this Ajinkya Rahane knock for a long time. Take a bow ____ pic.twitter.com/MbrWTV5AfB тАФ Yash MSdian __ _ (@itzyash07) April 8, 2023 #Rahane showing his performance to Indian team selectors. #MIvsCSK #CSK #AjinkyaRahane #Dhoni pic.twitter.com/CDfW1pUlxi тАФ The Honest Trader || wealthCompounders (@THEH0NESTTRADER) April 8, 2023 Ab toh Ajinkya Rahane ka form bhi waapis aa gaya, Tum kab aaogi? pic.twitter.com/ocKCM3KInV тАФ Veersain Singh ___ (@veersain_singh) April 8, 2023 No hate only facts - Ajinkya Rahane is the greatest player from Mumbai in IPL. pic.twitter.com/UB0WM9vclP тАФ SBA. (@OGKlolZone) April 8, 2023 Ajinkya Rahane ... giving a statement. & Making the most of the opportunity #CSKvsMI pic.twitter.com/933lB1uzws тАФ Deepak Singh Kushwah (@its_dsk) April 8, 2023 AJINKYA RAHANE _ pic.twitter.com/ycR2gq2lgh тАФ Tanmay / marcus rashford's defense attorney (@franchiseford) April 8, 2023 In the fourth over, the 34-year-old batsman from Mumbai smashed left-arm pacer Arshad Khan for 23 runs, including a six and four consecutive fours. This innings marks Rahane's seventh IPL franchise since 2008. The right-handed batsman reached his half-century in just 19 balls with successive boundaries off the bowling of Piyush Chawla in the sixth over, setting the record for the fastest fifty of the season so far. Rahane's belligerent innings has put the Chennai Super Kings in a strong position in their chase of 158 runs against Mumbai Indians. The batsman's exquisite strokeplay and aggressive intent have left the Mumbai bowlers bewildered and struggling to contain his onslaught. If Rahane can continue his impressive form, the Chennai Super Kings will fancy their chances of securing victory in this crucial encounter.

newsArray.title: Watch: Ravindra Jadeja pulls off brilliant catch to dismiss Cameron Green in MI vs CSK
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: Watch: Ravindra Jadeja pulls off brilliant catch to dismiss Cameron Green in MI vs CSK
newsArray.content: Cricket Watch: Ravindra Jadeja pulls off brilliant catch to dismiss Cameron Green in MI vs CSK Jadeja reacted in a fraction of a second after MI all-rounder Green smacked the ball hard in his direction, sending the Australian back to the dugout for 12 with the brilliant effort. FirstCricket Staff April 8th, 2023 22:06:18 IST Ravindra Jadeja finished the pick of the CSK bowlers with figures of 3/20 against MI. Sportzpics It turned out to be quite the memorable day for Ravindra Jadeja at the Wankhede Stadium as he would help Chennai Super Kings (CSK) restrict Mumbai Indians (MI) with a superb three-wicket burst. IPL 2023: Full coverage | Points table | Schedule | Results | Orange Cap | Purple CapтАЛ And it wasnтАЩt just with the ball that Jadeja stood out in the first тАШEl ClasicoтАЩ of the 2023 IPL season on Saturday; he would also pull off an outstanding reaction catch off his own bowling to dismiss MI all-rounder Cameron Green. Australian all-rounder Green, the second-most expensive player in the history of the IPL, attempted to smash the ball down the ground, and wouldтАЩve collected an easy boundary the way he had hit the ball. LIVE: MI vs CSK, Match 12 of IPL 2023 in Mumbai Jadeja, though, gave yet another exhibition of his lightning-quick reflexes as he stuck his hands out and pulled off what surely is one of the standout catches of the season so far. Watch the dismissal here: Sensational catch ЁЯФеЁЯФе @imjadeja grabs a RIPPER off his own bowling! Follow the match тЦ╢я╕П https://t.co/rSxD0lf5zJ #TATAIPL | #MIvCSK pic.twitter.com/HjnXep6tXF тАФ IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) April 8, 2023 So powerful was GreenтАЩs shot that umpire Chris Gaffaney jumped out of the way and was lying on the ground in a bid to save his head. Thankfully for him, JadejaтАЩs reflexes saved him from getting seriously injured. Besides the Green dismissal, Jadeja also accounted for the wickets of well-set opener Ishan Kishan (32) and Tilak Varma (22), removing the latter off his final delivery of the evening. Fellow left-arm spinner Mitchell Santner was also among the wickets, grabbing 2 for 28 in four as the Chennai spin pair strangled the Mumbai batters in the middle overs following a superb powerplay. Mumbai though, would cross 150 in the end, thanks to valuable contributions from Tim David (31 off 22) and Hrithik Shokeen (18 not out off 13), posting 157/8 after being invited to bat by Chennai. newsArray.title: JayasuriyaтАЩs mantra: CricketersтАЩ career is short so remain fit to make best use of it
creator: Press Trust of India
newsArray.description: Srinagar: Sri Lanka cricket legend Sanath Jayasuria on Saturday dismissed suggestions that too much cricket was leading to burnout saying the playing period at the top level was short and players should make optimum use of it. тАЬThat is an individual opinion and I would not like to comment on it. The period of playersтАЩ [тАж]
newsArray.content: Srinagar: Sri Lanka cricket legend Sanath Jayasuria on Saturday dismissed suggestions that too much cricket was leading to burnout saying the playing period at the top level was short and players should make optimum use of it. тАЬThat is an individual opinion and I would not like to comment on it. The period of playersтАЩ careers is short and they have to make best use of this time,тАЭ Jayasuria told reporters here. The тАШPlayer of the TournamentтАЩ in 1996 World Cup feels that fitness is paramount as the best years will allow an individual to ply his trade in various T20 leagues, which is fast changing the priority for a section of cricketers. тАЬYou cannot say тАШNoтАЩ to these things. At the end, the player has to decide how much his body can take,тАЭ he said. Jayasuriya was non-committal on most issues during his interaction with media. тАЬIt is too early to name three contenders. All the teams are playing good cricket right now,тАЭ Jayarusia replied when asked about favourites for the World Cup. Asked about chances of Sri Lanka, which has to play the qualifiers, going through to the main World Cup event, he said тАЬwe have to qualify first and I am confident.тАЭ Jayasuria threw his weight behind the T20 leagues around the world saying some good players have come to limelight from the instant form of cricket. тАЬIt is an individual opinion (that Test cricket is losing out to T20 cricket). We have seen good players coming through from T20 in India, Australia and Bangladesh,тАЭ he added. The former cricketer, who donned the Sri Lankan colours 586 times across the formats, was all praise for bats made of Kashmir willow тАЬI have played with Kashmiri bats, there is nothing wrong with these bats. It is up-to the individual players (whether they want to use it),тАЭ he said in response to a question. Asked if India and Pakistan should play each other beyond the ICC events, Jayasuria said тАЬI I cannot talk about domestic issues of your country. I am an outsider.тАЭ While refusing to take political questions about India, Kashmir or Sri Lanka, the former Sri Lankan MP said he wanted the media to highlight positive aspects of life in his native country. тАЬMy country went through a bad period. The protests went on for some time. Now the people want a future. We are looking forward. We donтАЩt have any issues now. We want the media to show positive things about Sri Lanka,тАЭ he added. PTI JayasuriyaтАЩs mantra: CricketersтАЩ career is short so remain fit to make best use of it added by Press Trust of India on 1:43 am April 9, 2023 View all posts by Press Trust of India тЖТ Press Trust of India Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Email Print Related

newsArray.description: Arsenal legend Paul Merson has warned Chelsea ahead of their Champions League quarter-final clash with Real Madrid on Wednesday. Merson said it would be a walk in the park for Real Madrid if the Blues approach the game as they did in their Premier League game with Wolves on Saturday. Chelsea were beaten 1-0 by [тАж] UCL: ItтАЩd be pointless going to Real Madrid тАУ Merson warns Chelsea after Wolves defeat
newsArray.content: Daily Post Nigeria UCL: ItтАЩd be pointless going to Real Madrid тАУ Merson warns Chelsea after Wolves defeat Home News Politics Metro Entertainment Sport Sport UCL: ItтАЩd be pointless going to Real Madrid тАУ Merson warns Chelsea after Wolves defeat Published on April 8, 2023 By John Owen Nwachukwu Arsenal legend Paul Merson has warned Chelsea ahead of their Champions League quarter-final clash with Real Madrid on Wednesday. Merson said it would be a walk in the park for Real Madrid if the Blues approach the game as they did in their Premier League game with Wolves on Saturday. Chelsea were beaten 1-0 by the Wanderers courtesy of a 31st-minute strike scored by Matheus Nunes. Merson noted that Chelsea were beaten because they lacked urgency in their game. He warned that if the same thing happens against Real Madrid next week, the Blues could suffer a heavier defeat at the hands of Los Blancos. тАЬMy only benefit of the doubt is theyтАЩre waiting for Wednesday night,тАЭ he told Sky Sports. тАЬThat is the only thing I can think of. If they turn up like that on Wednesday night, it will be pointless going to the second leg. newsArray.title: Ajinkya Rahane hits this IPL's fastest 50 in Mumbai win over Chennai
newsArray.description: In another one-sided game, league-leading Rajasthan Royals handed Delhi Capitals their third straight defeat. Mumbai, Delhi and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all at the bottom of the table without a point. Mumbai rested its big signing Jofra Archer as a precaution after the fast bowler complained of pain in his bowling arm. But it was the batting which disappointed.
newsArray.content: Synopsis In another one-sided game, league-leading Rajasthan Royals handed Delhi Capitals their third straight defeat. Mumbai, Delhi and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all at the bottom of the table without a point. Mumbai rested its big signing Jofra Archer as a precaution after the fast bowler complained of pain in his bowling arm. But it was the batting which disappointed. AP Rahane's 61 off 27 balls included a six and four boundaries in one over. Ajinkya Rahane hit the fastest half-century in this Indian Premier League off 19 balls and led Chennai Super Kings to a comfortable seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Saturday. In another one-sided game, league-leading Rajasthan Royals handed Delhi Capitals their third straight defeat. Mumbai, Delhi and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all at the bottom of the table without a point. Mumbai rested its big signing Jofra Archer as a precaution after the fast bowler complained of pain in his bowling arm. But it was the batting which disappointed. Despite a bright start, Mumbai lost its way after captain Rohit Sharma was out for 21 and limped to 157-8. Chennai made short work of that in cruising to 159-3 with 11 balls to spare for its second win in three games. Spinners Ravindra Jadeja (3-20) and Mitchell Santner (2-28) derailed Mumbai's innings. Sharma was brilliantly squared up by Tushar Deshpande (2-31), who hit the top of the middle and off stumps. Chennai was without its own key Englishmen in Ben Stokes (sore heel) and Moeen Ali (ill) and didn't miss them. Rahane's 61 off 27 balls included a six and four boundaries in one over. He raced to his half-century with two successive boundaries against legspinner Piyush Chawla within the powerplay. Rahane was finally dismissed when he miscued Chawla and holed out in the deep in the eighth over. Ruturaj Gaikwad finished off the chase with an unbeaten 40. RAJASTHAN THUMPS DELHI Rajasthan openers Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal smacked half-centuries to launch them to 199-4 and a win by 57 runs. Buttler blazed 79 off 51 balls and Jaiswal, who began with five boundaries in the first over, made 60 off 31 balls. Delhi was squeezed to 142-9. Trent Boult's double-wicket start in his 3-29 set the tone, and spinners Yuzvendra Chahal (3-27) and Ravichandran Ashwin (2-25) frustrated the middle order. Made to bat first, Jaiswal raised his half-century off 25 balls with his 11th boundary by flicking left-arm spinner Axar Patel to wide long on. Jaiswal was dismissed in the ninth over when he top-edged Mukesh Kumar after a rollicking platform of 98 with Buttler. Buttler hit 11 fours and a six and departed in the penultimate over when Kumar juggled a catch off his own bowling. Shimron Hetmyer added a rapid 39 off 21 balls in the death overs, and the total was too intimidating for Delhi. Boult was on a hat trick after he nicked off Prithvi Shaw and pinned Manish Pandey but Rilee Rossouw survived to make 14. Lalit Yadav (38) and David Warner added 64 runs for the fourth wicket before Delhi lost six wickets for 40 runs. Boult returned and broke the stand by trapping Yadav. Warner labored for 55 balls for his 65 before he was lbw to Chahal in the 19th over. ___ More AP cricket: https://apnews.com/hub/cricket and https://twitter.com/AP_Sports DonтАЩt miss out on ET Prime stories! newsArray.title: Twitter Can't Keep Clam As Ajinkya Rahane Hits Fastest Fifty Of IPL 2023 In MI vs CSK Game - Check
newsArray.description: In the fourth over, the 34-year-old batsman from Mumbai smashed left-arm pacer Arshad Khan for 23 runs, including a six and four consecutive fours.
newsArray.content: Making his Chennai Super Kings debut, Ajinkya Rahane played a sensational innings, scoring a blistering half-century against Mumbai Indians in an IPL 2023 match held at the Wankhede Stadium on Saturday. Coming in at no. 3 after the early dismissal of Devon Conway, Rahane hit his first ball for two runs. He then upped the ante in Jason Behrendorff's second over by swivel-pulling a short delivery over deep fine leg for six before unleashing in the next over. Also Read: Watch: Ravindra Jadeja Takes No-Look Stunner To Dismiss Cameron Green, Saves Umpire From Getting Hit #AjinkyaRahane 61(27) _ Fours 7 Sixes 3 Much needed contribution at the right time _ Well played Buddy _ #CSKvsMI @ChennaiIPL pic.twitter.com/2r1skyNC3L тАФ Filmi craft (@filmicraft) April 8, 2023 #AjinkyaRahane Ajinkya Rahane Before Vs Tonight ____ #MIvsCSK pic.twitter.com/BW8Or9sOwk тАФ _________ (@battyphilo) April 8, 2023 Some 61s are more special than others. T20I Debut - 31 August, 2011 61 (39) v _______ IPL Comeback - 8 April, 2023 61 (27) vs #MI #India #CricketTwitter #CSKvsMI #MIvCSK #AjinkyaRahane pic.twitter.com/8fXlOdyyGe тАФ Broken Cricket Dreams Cricket Blog (@cricket_broken) April 8, 2023 #Rahane joined dhoom dhadaka club __ #CSKvsMI #MIvsCSK #AjinkyaRahane pic.twitter.com/fQ9WhU4Kpl тАФ Bindass27 (@bindass27) April 8, 2023 Pure Class, Such a Joyful to watch #Rahane playing a beautiful knock. Quality of Cricket. Always been a great fan of his batting skills. Love you Ajju Bhai... #Jinx ___ @ajinkyarahane88 #AjinkyaRahane #CSKvsMI #MIvsCSK #IPL2023 Hope to you see in #wtcfinal тАФ Harish__ (@harish_207) April 8, 2023 People will remember this Ajinkya Rahane knock for a long time. Take a bow ____ pic.twitter.com/MbrWTV5AfB тАФ Yash MSdian __ _ (@itzyash07) April 8, 2023 #Rahane showing his performance to Indian team selectors. #MIvsCSK #CSK #AjinkyaRahane #Dhoni pic.twitter.com/CDfW1pUlxi тАФ The Honest Trader || wealthCompounders (@THEH0NESTTRADER) April 8, 2023 Ab toh Ajinkya Rahane ka form bhi waapis aa gaya, Tum kab aaogi? pic.twitter.com/ocKCM3KInV тАФ Veersain Singh ___ (@veersain_singh) April 8, 2023 No hate only facts - Ajinkya Rahane is the greatest player from Mumbai in IPL. pic.twitter.com/UB0WM9vclP тАФ SBA. (@OGKlolZone) April 8, 2023 Ajinkya Rahane ... giving a statement. & Making the most of the opportunity #CSKvsMI pic.twitter.com/933lB1uzws тАФ Deepak Singh Kushwah (@its_dsk) April 8, 2023 AJINKYA RAHANE _ pic.twitter.com/ycR2gq2lgh тАФ Tanmay / marcus rashford's defense attorney (@franchiseford) April 8, 2023 In the fourth over, the 34-year-old batsman from Mumbai smashed left-arm pacer Arshad Khan for 23 runs, including a six and four consecutive fours. This innings marks Rahane's seventh IPL franchise since 2008. The right-handed batsman reached his half-century in just 19 balls with successive boundaries off the bowling of Piyush Chawla in the sixth over, setting the record for the fastest fifty of the season so far. Rahane's belligerent innings has put the Chennai Super Kings in a strong position in their chase of 158 runs against Mumbai Indians. The batsman's exquisite strokeplay and aggressive intent have left the Mumbai bowlers bewildered and struggling to contain his onslaught. If Rahane can continue his impressive form, the Chennai Super Kings will fancy their chances of securing victory in this crucial encounter.

newsArray.title: Watch: Ravindra Jadeja pulls off brilliant catch to dismiss Cameron Green in MI vs CSK
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: Watch: Ravindra Jadeja pulls off brilliant catch to dismiss Cameron Green in MI vs CSK
newsArray.content: Cricket Watch: Ravindra Jadeja pulls off brilliant catch to dismiss Cameron Green in MI vs CSK Jadeja reacted in a fraction of a second after MI all-rounder Green smacked the ball hard in his direction, sending the Australian back to the dugout for 12 with the brilliant effort. FirstCricket Staff April 8th, 2023 22:06:18 IST Ravindra Jadeja finished the pick of the CSK bowlers with figures of 3/20 against MI. Sportzpics It turned out to be quite the memorable day for Ravindra Jadeja at the Wankhede Stadium as he would help Chennai Super Kings (CSK) restrict Mumbai Indians (MI) with a superb three-wicket burst. IPL 2023: Full coverage | Points table | Schedule | Results | Orange Cap | Purple CapтАЛ And it wasnтАЩt just with the ball that Jadeja stood out in the first тАШEl ClasicoтАЩ of the 2023 IPL season on Saturday; he would also pull off an outstanding reaction catch off his own bowling to dismiss MI all-rounder Cameron Green. Australian all-rounder Green, the second-most expensive player in the history of the IPL, attempted to smash the ball down the ground, and wouldтАЩve collected an easy boundary the way he had hit the ball. LIVE: MI vs CSK, Match 12 of IPL 2023 in Mumbai Jadeja, though, gave yet another exhibition of his lightning-quick reflexes as he stuck his hands out and pulled off what surely is one of the standout catches of the season so far. Watch the dismissal here: Sensational catch ЁЯФеЁЯФе @imjadeja grabs a RIPPER off his own bowling! Follow the match тЦ╢я╕П https://t.co/rSxD0lf5zJ #TATAIPL | #MIvCSK pic.twitter.com/HjnXep6tXF тАФ IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) April 8, 2023 So powerful was GreenтАЩs shot that umpire Chris Gaffaney jumped out of the way and was lying on the ground in a bid to save his head. Thankfully for him, JadejaтАЩs reflexes saved him from getting seriously injured. Besides the Green dismissal, Jadeja also accounted for the wickets of well-set opener Ishan Kishan (32) and Tilak Varma (22), removing the latter off his final delivery of the evening. Fellow left-arm spinner Mitchell Santner was also among the wickets, grabbing 2 for 28 in four as the Chennai spin pair strangled the Mumbai batters in the middle overs following a superb powerplay. Mumbai though, would cross 150 in the end, thanks to valuable contributions from Tim David (31 off 22) and Hrithik Shokeen (18 not out off 13), posting 157/8 after being invited to bat by Chennai. newsArray.title: JayasuriyaтАЩs mantra: CricketersтАЩ career is short so remain fit to make best use of it
creator: Press Trust of India
newsArray.description: Srinagar: Sri Lanka cricket legend Sanath Jayasuria on Saturday dismissed suggestions that too much cricket was leading to burnout saying the playing period at the top level was short and players should make optimum use of it. тАЬThat is an individual opinion and I would not like to comment on it. The period of playersтАЩ [тАж]
newsArray.content: Srinagar: Sri Lanka cricket legend Sanath Jayasuria on Saturday dismissed suggestions that too much cricket was leading to burnout saying the playing period at the top level was short and players should make optimum use of it. тАЬThat is an individual opinion and I would not like to comment on it. The period of playersтАЩ careers is short and they have to make best use of this time,тАЭ Jayasuria told reporters here. The тАШPlayer of the TournamentтАЩ in 1996 World Cup feels that fitness is paramount as the best years will allow an individual to ply his trade in various T20 leagues, which is fast changing the priority for a section of cricketers. тАЬYou cannot say тАШNoтАЩ to these things. At the end, the player has to decide how much his body can take,тАЭ he said. Jayasuriya was non-committal on most issues during his interaction with media. тАЬIt is too early to name three contenders. All the teams are playing good cricket right now,тАЭ Jayarusia replied when asked about favourites for the World Cup. Asked about chances of Sri Lanka, which has to play the qualifiers, going through to the main World Cup event, he said тАЬwe have to qualify first and I am confident.тАЭ Jayasuria threw his weight behind the T20 leagues around the world saying some good players have come to limelight from the instant form of cricket. тАЬIt is an individual opinion (that Test cricket is losing out to T20 cricket). We have seen good players coming through from T20 in India, Australia and Bangladesh,тАЭ he added. The former cricketer, who donned the Sri Lankan colours 586 times across the formats, was all praise for bats made of Kashmir willow тАЬI have played with Kashmiri bats, there is nothing wrong with these bats. It is up-to the individual players (whether they want to use it),тАЭ he said in response to a question. Asked if India and Pakistan should play each other beyond the ICC events, Jayasuria said тАЬI I cannot talk about domestic issues of your country. I am an outsider.тАЭ While refusing to take political questions about India, Kashmir or Sri Lanka, the former Sri Lankan MP said he wanted the media to highlight positive aspects of life in his native country. тАЬMy country went through a bad period. The protests went on for some time. Now the people want a future. We are looking forward. We donтАЩt have any issues now. We want the media to show positive things about Sri Lanka,тАЭ he added. PTI JayasuriyaтАЩs mantra: CricketersтАЩ career is short so remain fit to make best use of it added by Press Trust of India on 1:43 am April 9, 2023 View all posts by Press Trust of India тЖТ Press Trust of India Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Email Print Related

newsArray.description: Arsenal legend Paul Merson has warned Chelsea ahead of their Champions League quarter-final clash with Real Madrid on Wednesday. Merson said it would be a walk in the park for Real Madrid if the Blues approach the game as they did in their Premier League game with Wolves on Saturday. Chelsea were beaten 1-0 by [тАж] UCL: ItтАЩd be pointless going to Real Madrid тАУ Merson warns Chelsea after Wolves defeat
newsArray.content: Daily Post Nigeria UCL: ItтАЩd be pointless going to Real Madrid тАУ Merson warns Chelsea after Wolves defeat Home News Politics Metro Entertainment Sport Sport UCL: ItтАЩd be pointless going to Real Madrid тАУ Merson warns Chelsea after Wolves defeat Published on April 8, 2023 By John Owen Nwachukwu Arsenal legend Paul Merson has warned Chelsea ahead of their Champions League quarter-final clash with Real Madrid on Wednesday. Merson said it would be a walk in the park for Real Madrid if the Blues approach the game as they did in their Premier League game with Wolves on Saturday. Chelsea were beaten 1-0 by the Wanderers courtesy of a 31st-minute strike scored by Matheus Nunes. Merson noted that Chelsea were beaten because they lacked urgency in their game. He warned that if the same thing happens against Real Madrid next week, the Blues could suffer a heavier defeat at the hands of Los Blancos. тАЬMy only benefit of the doubt is theyтАЩre waiting for Wednesday night,тАЭ he told Sky Sports. тАЬThat is the only thing I can think of. If they turn up like that on Wednesday night, it will be pointless going to the second leg. newsArray.title: Ajinkya Rahane hits this IPL's fastest 50 in Mumbai win over Chennai
newsArray.description: In another one-sided game, league-leading Rajasthan Royals handed Delhi Capitals their third straight defeat. Mumbai, Delhi and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all at the bottom of the table without a point. Mumbai rested its big signing Jofra Archer as a precaution after the fast bowler complained of pain in his bowling arm. But it was the batting which disappointed.
newsArray.content: Synopsis In another one-sided game, league-leading Rajasthan Royals handed Delhi Capitals their third straight defeat. Mumbai, Delhi and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all at the bottom of the table without a point. Mumbai rested its big signing Jofra Archer as a precaution after the fast bowler complained of pain in his bowling arm. But it was the batting which disappointed. AP Rahane's 61 off 27 balls included a six and four boundaries in one over. Ajinkya Rahane hit the fastest half-century in this Indian Premier League off 19 balls and led Chennai Super Kings to a comfortable seven-wicket win over Mumbai Indians on Saturday. In another one-sided game, league-leading Rajasthan Royals handed Delhi Capitals their third straight defeat. Mumbai, Delhi and Sunrisers Hyderabad are all at the bottom of the table without a point. Mumbai rested its big signing Jofra Archer as a precaution after the fast bowler complained of pain in his bowling arm. But it was the batting which disappointed. Despite a bright start, Mumbai lost its way after captain Rohit Sharma was out for 21 and limped to 157-8. Chennai made short work of that in cruising to 159-3 with 11 balls to spare for its second win in three games. Spinners Ravindra Jadeja (3-20) and Mitchell Santner (2-28) derailed Mumbai's innings. Sharma was brilliantly squared up by Tushar Deshpande (2-31), who hit the top of the middle and off stumps. Chennai was without its own key Englishmen in Ben Stokes (sore heel) and Moeen Ali (ill) and didn't miss them. Rahane's 61 off 27 balls included a six and four boundaries in one over. He raced to his half-century with two successive boundaries against legspinner Piyush Chawla within the powerplay. Rahane was finally dismissed when he miscued Chawla and holed out in the deep in the eighth over. Ruturaj Gaikwad finished off the chase with an unbeaten 40. RAJASTHAN THUMPS DELHI Rajasthan openers Jos Buttler and Yashasvi Jaiswal smacked half-centuries to launch them to 199-4 and a win by 57 runs. Buttler blazed 79 off 51 balls and Jaiswal, who began with five boundaries in the first over, made 60 off 31 balls. Delhi was squeezed to 142-9. Trent Boult's double-wicket start in his 3-29 set the tone, and spinners Yuzvendra Chahal (3-27) and Ravichandran Ashwin (2-25) frustrated the middle order. Made to bat first, Jaiswal raised his half-century off 25 balls with his 11th boundary by flicking left-arm spinner Axar Patel to wide long on. Jaiswal was dismissed in the ninth over when he top-edged Mukesh Kumar after a rollicking platform of 98 with Buttler. Buttler hit 11 fours and a six and departed in the penultimate over when Kumar juggled a catch off his own bowling. Shimron Hetmyer added a rapid 39 off 21 balls in the death overs, and the total was too intimidating for Delhi. Boult was on a hat trick after he nicked off Prithvi Shaw and pinned Manish Pandey but Rilee Rossouw survived to make 14. Lalit Yadav (38) and David Warner added 64 runs for the fourth wicket before Delhi lost six wickets for 40 runs. Boult returned and broke the stand by trapping Yadav. Warner labored for 55 balls for his 65 before he was lbw to Chahal in the 19th over. ___ More AP cricket: https://apnews.com/hub/cricket and https://twitter.com/AP_Sports DonтАЩt miss out on ET Prime stories! newsArray.title: Twitter Can't Keep Clam As Ajinkya Rahane Hits Fastest Fifty Of IPL 2023 In MI vs CSK Game - Check
newsArray.description: In the fourth over, the 34-year-old batsman from Mumbai smashed left-arm pacer Arshad Khan for 23 runs, including a six and four consecutive fours.
newsArray.content: Making his Chennai Super Kings debut, Ajinkya Rahane played a sensational innings, scoring a blistering half-century against Mumbai Indians in an IPL 2023 match held at the Wankhede Stadium on Saturday. Coming in at no. 3 after the early dismissal of Devon Conway, Rahane hit his first ball for two runs. He then upped the ante in Jason Behrendorff's second over by swivel-pulling a short delivery over deep fine leg for six before unleashing in the next over. Also Read: Watch: Ravindra Jadeja Takes No-Look Stunner To Dismiss Cameron Green, Saves Umpire From Getting Hit #AjinkyaRahane 61(27) _ Fours 7 Sixes 3 Much needed contribution at the right time _ Well played Buddy _ #CSKvsMI @ChennaiIPL pic.twitter.com/2r1skyNC3L тАФ Filmi craft (@filmicraft) April 8, 2023 #AjinkyaRahane Ajinkya Rahane Before Vs Tonight ____ #MIvsCSK pic.twitter.com/BW8Or9sOwk тАФ _________ (@battyphilo) April 8, 2023 Some 61s are more special than others. T20I Debut - 31 August, 2011 61 (39) v _______ IPL Comeback - 8 April, 2023 61 (27) vs #MI #India #CricketTwitter #CSKvsMI #MIvCSK #AjinkyaRahane pic.twitter.com/8fXlOdyyGe тАФ Broken Cricket Dreams Cricket Blog (@cricket_broken) April 8, 2023 #Rahane joined dhoom dhadaka club __ #CSKvsMI #MIvsCSK #AjinkyaRahane pic.twitter.com/fQ9WhU4Kpl тАФ Bindass27 (@bindass27) April 8, 2023 Pure Class, Such a Joyful to watch #Rahane playing a beautiful knock. Quality of Cricket. Always been a great fan of his batting skills. Love you Ajju Bhai... #Jinx ___ @ajinkyarahane88 #AjinkyaRahane #CSKvsMI #MIvsCSK #IPL2023 Hope to you see in #wtcfinal тАФ Harish__ (@harish_207) April 8, 2023 People will remember this Ajinkya Rahane knock for a long time. Take a bow ____ pic.twitter.com/MbrWTV5AfB тАФ Yash MSdian __ _ (@itzyash07) April 8, 2023 #Rahane showing his performance to Indian team selectors. #MIvsCSK #CSK #AjinkyaRahane #Dhoni pic.twitter.com/CDfW1pUlxi тАФ The Honest Trader || wealthCompounders (@THEH0NESTTRADER) April 8, 2023 Ab toh Ajinkya Rahane ka form bhi waapis aa gaya, Tum kab aaogi? pic.twitter.com/ocKCM3KInV тАФ Veersain Singh ___ (@veersain_singh) April 8, 2023 No hate only facts - Ajinkya Rahane is the greatest player from Mumbai in IPL. pic.twitter.com/UB0WM9vclP тАФ SBA. (@OGKlolZone) April 8, 2023 Ajinkya Rahane ... giving a statement. & Making the most of the opportunity #CSKvsMI pic.twitter.com/933lB1uzws тАФ Deepak Singh Kushwah (@its_dsk) April 8, 2023 AJINKYA RAHANE _ pic.twitter.com/ycR2gq2lgh тАФ Tanmay / marcus rashford's defense attorney (@franchiseford) April 8, 2023 In the fourth over, the 34-year-old batsman from Mumbai smashed left-arm pacer Arshad Khan for 23 runs, including a six and four consecutive fours. This innings marks Rahane's seventh IPL franchise since 2008. The right-handed batsman reached his half-century in just 19 balls with successive boundaries off the bowling of Piyush Chawla in the sixth over, setting the record for the fastest fifty of the season so far. Rahane's belligerent innings has put the Chennai Super Kings in a strong position in their chase of 158 runs against Mumbai Indians. The batsman's exquisite strokeplay and aggressive intent have left the Mumbai bowlers bewildered and struggling to contain his onslaught. If Rahane can continue his impressive form, the Chennai Super Kings will fancy their chances of securing victory in this crucial encounter.

newsArray.title: Watch: Ravindra Jadeja pulls off brilliant catch to dismiss Cameron Green in MI vs CSK
creator: FirstCricket Staff
newsArray.description: Watch: Ravindra Jadeja pulls off brilliant catch to dismiss Cameron Green in MI vs CSK
newsArray.content: Cricket Watch: Ravindra Jadeja pulls off brilliant catch to dismiss Cameron Green in MI vs CSK Jadeja reacted in a fraction of a second after MI all-rounder Green smacked the ball hard in his direction, sending the Australian back to the dugout for 12 with the brilliant effort. FirstCricket Staff April 8th, 2023 22:06:18 IST Ravindra Jadeja finished the pick of the CSK bowlers with figures of 3/20 against MI. Sportzpics It turned out to be quite the memorable day for Ravindra Jadeja at the Wankhede Stadium as he would help Chennai Super Kings (CSK) restrict Mumbai Indians (MI) with a superb three-wicket burst. IPL 2023: Full coverage | Points table | Schedule | Results | Orange Cap | Purple CapтАЛ And it wasnтАЩt just with the ball that Jadeja stood out in the first тАШEl ClasicoтАЩ of the 2023 IPL season on Saturday; he would also pull off an outstanding reaction catch off his own bowling to dismiss MI all-rounder Cameron Green. Australian all-rounder Green, the second-most expensive player in the history of the IPL, attempted to smash the ball down the ground, and wouldтАЩve collected an easy boundary the way he had hit the ball. LIVE: MI vs CSK, Match 12 of IPL 2023 in Mumbai Jadeja, though, gave yet another exhibition of his lightning-quick reflexes as he stuck his hands out and pulled off what surely is one of the standout catches of the season so far. Watch the dismissal here: Sensational catch ЁЯФеЁЯФе @imjadeja grabs a RIPPER off his own bowling! Follow the match тЦ╢я╕П https://t.co/rSxD0lf5zJ #TATAIPL | #MIvCSK pic.twitter.com/HjnXep6tXF тАФ IndianPremierLeague (@IPL) April 8, 2023 So powerful was GreenтАЩs shot that umpire Chris Gaffaney jumped out of the way and was lying on the ground in a bid to save his head. Thankfully for him, JadejaтАЩs reflexes saved him from getting seriously injured. Besides the Green dismissal, Jadeja also accounted for the wickets of well-set opener Ishan Kishan (32) and Tilak Varma (22), removing the latter off his final delivery of the evening. Fellow left-arm spinner Mitchell Santner was also among the wickets, grabbing 2 for 28 in four as the Chennai spin pair strangled the Mumbai batters in the middle overs following a superb powerplay. Mumbai though, would cross 150 in the end, thanks to valuable contributions from Tim David (31 off 22) and Hrithik Shokeen (18 not out off 13), posting 157/8 after being invited to bat by Chennai.
